subject: Design
title: Le Corbusier: The Machine for Living
description: A fast breakdown of Le Corbusier: The Machine for Living for builders.

hook.text: Le Corbusier called a house 'a machine for living in.' He meant it as a compliment.

buildup.text: He stripped interiors to essentials: white walls, open floors, built-in storage, and floods of light.

discovery.text: His Villa Savoie (1931) had no ornament, no clutter â€” just space, light, and function.

twist.text: The Villa leaked constantly. The owner sued. The machine for living didn't actually work.

climax.text: Le Corbusier's ideas shaped 20th-century housing even though his own buildings were often impractical.

punchline.text: The most influential home designer built homes people couldn't live in.

quiz.question: What did Le Corbusier famously call a house?
